page.title: 01BIOGRAPHY
page.content: { {COUNTESS BEAUCHAMP, MADRESFIELD COURT. {In}about 1100 a house stood on the site where{Madresfield Court}is now.{ {In}1547 that house was knocked down and the Court was built.{It}is now 437 years old.{Before}she married the Earl, she was married to an MP.{She met the Earl at Worcester Shrub Hill Station.{Her}life changed after her 2nd marriage as she had to open bazaars.{She}originally came from Denmark but spent some time in Paris. She owns 5000 acres of land,1000 being woodland.{In}the Court grounds there is a maze.{The}house has 100 rooms(65 are bedrooms).{The}house is built of red bricks.{Events}at the Court-{Daffodil Sunday,Madresfield {Show(since 1890),Whist Drives,WI {meetings. There}are 10 servants. {(by Tracey Bennett/Claire Nunney)
